_header: When said was all this miracle every man
Title(s): Prologue to Sir Thopas; ‘Words of the Host to Chaucer’; Canterbury Tales
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Prologue to Sir Thopas in the Canterbury Tales — 21 lines in 7-line, rhyme royal stanzas.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
When seide was this miracle euery manas sobre was that wonder was
                    to se…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…ye that is good quod he shul we heresom deynte thing me
                    thenketh bi thi chere
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And / next the Ost commaundith Chauncers to telle (f.
                        167v); Chauncers (RT)

BodBar20.First Lines:
Whan said was þis tale euery manAs Sober was þat wonder
                    was to se…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…He þat is gode quod he now shul were hereSome deynte
                    thing me thinkith by his chere
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…And here / by gynnethe þe prologe of Thopas (f. 203); here
                    endithe þe prologe… (f. 203)

Bod414.First Lines:
[W]hen endid was þis miracle euery manAlle sobur were wundir
                    it was to se…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…Ye that is good coth he shulle we it hereSum deintee thing me
                    think be thy chere
Bod414.Attributed Title: The Prolog of Chaucers tale of ser Thopas (f. 148)

CamTCC582.Transcription:
Whan Chaucers be oure oost was praideTo telle a tale he is nat
                    withsaidBut beningly and with gode chereBegan his tale and saide as
                    folwith hiere
CamTCC582.Note: Four spurious lines in lieu of the usual link.
CamTCC582.Attributed Title:
…A Prolog and a tale tolde by Master Chaucer (f.
                    87rb)
